page.title: 17John Martin Charity,Evesham.
page.content: {On 28th June 1714 John Martin died.}He had bought{lOO acres}of land for l5O and{rented}the land out. John Martin had no surviving family so{he founded {a charity. Nowadays the rent and {investment interest is l5,OOO.}The {people who get a share}of the money are the Vicars of Hampton and Benge- worth, students at college or univer- sity and our school. Soon the Council are going to build a{bypass}going through the land that the John Martin Charity owns. They will have to buy the land and{builders}will buy more of it for housing, so there will be lot {more money}for the Charity. There are fourteen{trustees.}They meet once a month to decide how much money to share out. Some things that were {bought for our school}are hockey shirts,music stands,video recorder, computer disc-drive & woodwork tools.
